Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

Job Description

Workday is looking for outstanding software engineers to join our Performance and Scalability Team that is part of Tools (Backend) engineering team. The Performance and Scalability team is a full stack engineering team, responsible for Workday’s applications in a holistic way. Performance Engineers are highly skilled engineers who debug, measure, analyze, and improve our Workday software. They are generalists with deep technical understanding of software, hardware, networking, and the Internet. Application Performance is achieved by working closely with all our engineering teams throughout the release cycle. Our ultimate goal is application performance that yields an excellent end user experience and scales to meet Software, as a Service Infrastructure needs.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:
  • Work with various groups within the company to understand business needs, collect and distill volumes of data, and conduct in-depth analysis.
  • Characterize and Model performance system trends to drive technical decision-making and present to stakeholders.
  • Create ad hoc/regular dashboards and reports on key business metrics for monitoring and triaging purpose.
  • Capacity estimating, modeling, or planning
  • Write scripts to automate repetitive tasks.
Requirements:
  • 2+ years’ experience in data analysis of large and complex data sets
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python or Scala
  • Ability to distill volumes of data, analyze performance results, to - Experience with big data frameworks (Hadoop, Spark)
  • Hands-on Unix/Linux knowledge
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher. Computer Science/ Statistical related major is preferable
  • Collaborative team player
  • Proven ability to learn quickly, be self-motivated, and in a fast-paced environment
